00081   class IdxSpec {

00098     intg offset;
00100     intg *dim;
00102     intg *mod;
00103 
00111     intg resize(intg s0=-1, intg s1=-1, intg s2=-1, intg s3=-1,
00112                 intg s4=-1, intg s5=-1, intg s6=-1, intg s7=-1);
00113     
00117     intg resize(const IdxDim &d);
00118 
00122     intg resize1(intg dimn, intg size);
00123 
00124     template<typename SizeIter> intg resize( SizeIter& dimsBegin, 
00125                                              SizeIter& dimsEnd ){
00126       const int nArgDims = std::distance(dimsBegin, dimsEnd);
00127 
00128       // Error-check the supplied number of dims.
00129       if( ndim == 0 ){
00130         ylerror("Cannot call resize on a 0-dimensional IdxSpec.");
00131       }
00132       else if( ndim != nArgDims ){
00133         std::ostringstream oss;
00134         oss<<"Number of supplied dimension sizes ("<<nArgDims;
00135         oss<<") doesn't match IdxSpec's number of dims ("<<ndim<<")";
00136         ylerror(oss.str().c_str());
00137       }
00138 
00139       // copy dimensions to dim
00140       std::copy(dimsBegin, dimsEnd, dim);
00141 
00142       // set mod to be the partial sum of the dim sequence, in reverse order.
00143       typedef std::reverse_iterator<SizeIter> RIter;
00144       typedef std::reverse_iterator<intg*> RintgIter;
00145       std::partial_sum( RIter(dimsEnd-1),
00146                         RIter(dimsBegin-1),
00147                         RintgIter(mod+(nArgDims-1)),
00148                         std::multiplies<intg>() );
00149 
00150       // return the memory footprint
00151       return mod[0] * dim[0] + offset;
00152     }
00153 
00155     intg setoffset(intg o) { return offset = o; }
00156 
00158     void init_spec(intg o, intg s0, intg s1, intg s2, intg s3, 
00159                    intg s4, intg s5, intg s6, intg s7);
00160 
00161   public:
00162 
00164     virtual ~IdxSpec();
00165 
00167     const IdxSpec& operator=(const IdxSpec& src);
00168 
00170     void copy(const IdxSpec& src);
00171 
00173     IdxSpec(const IdxSpec& src);

00196             intg s4=-1, intg s5=-1, intg s6=-1, intg s7=-1);

00330   template <class T> class Idx {
00331   private:
00332 
00334     Srg<T> *storage;
00335 
00337     void growstorage();
00338 
00340     void growstorage_chunk(intg s_chunk);
00341 
00343     void printElems_impl( int indent, std::ostream& );
00344 
00345   protected:
00348     Idx(dummyt *dummy);
00349 
00350   public:
00351 
00354     IdxSpec spec;
00355 
00357     virtual ~Idx();
00358 
00359     // TODO: Find out why code such as Idx<float> = 1 compiles
00360     // (even without default operator below).
00361     // default operator below outputs an error that this is forbidden.
00362     virtual Idx<T>& operator=(T other){
00363       ylerror("Forbidden Idx assignment. Idx can only be assigned another Idx");
00364       return *this;
00365     }
00366 
00367     virtual Idx<T>& operator=(const Idx<T>& other) {
00368       Srg<T> *tmp = NULL;
00369       if (this->storage != NULL)
00370         tmp = this->storage;
00371       this->storage = other.storage;
00372       this->spec = other.spec;
00373       this->storage->lock();
00374       if (tmp)
00375         tmp->unlock();
00376       return *this;
00377     }
00378 
00379     virtual Idx<T> operator[](const intg i) {
00380       return this->select(0,i);
00381     }
00382 
00384     // Keep this 'explicit' until we decide to implement operator=.
00385     //Idx( Idx<T>& other );
00386     //Idx( const Idx<T>& other );
00387 
00390     Idx(int n, intg *dims, intg *mods);
00391         
00392   Idx( const Idx<T>& other )
00393     :storage(other.storage),
00394       spec(other.spec)
00395         {
00396           storage->lock();
00397         }
00398

00499 
00506     template<typename SizeIter>
00507       void resize( SizeIter& sizesBegin, SizeIter& sizesEnd) {
00508       const int ndims = std::distance( sizesBegin, sizesEnd );
00509       if ( ndims > MAXDIMS ){
00510         std::ostringstream oss;
00511         oss<<"Number of dimensions ("<<ndims<<") exceeds MAX_DIMS (";
00512         oss<<MAXDIMS<<")";
00513         ylerror(oss.str().c_str());
00514       }
00515 
00516       std::vector<T> sizes(ndims+1);
00517       std::copy(sizesBegin, sizesEnd, sizes.begin());
00518       sizes.back() = -1;
00519       spec.resize( sizesBegin, sizesEnd );
00520       growstorage();
00521     }

00719   template <class T> class IdxLooper : public Idx<T> {
00720 
00721   public:
00722     intg i;  // loop index
00723     intg dimd;  // number of elements to iterated upon
00724     intg modd; // stride in dimension being iterated upon
00725 
00727     IdxLooper(Idx<T> &idx, int ld);
00728 
00730     bool notdone();
00731 
00733     T *next();
00734 
00735     void operator++();
00736   };

00739   // Idx Iterators: gives you a pointer to the actual data,
00740   // unlike IdxLooper which gives you another Idx.
00741 
00756   template <class T> class IdxIter {
00757 
00758   public:
00760     T *data;
00762     intg i;
00764     intg n;
00766     int j;
00768     intg d[MAXDIMS];
00770     Idx<T> *iterand;
00771 
00773     IdxIter();
00774 
00777     T *init(Idx<T> &idx);
00778 
00780     bool notdone();
00781 
00783     T *next();
00784 
00786     T& operator*() { return *data; }
00787 
00788   };
00789 
00791 #endif // if USING_STL_ITERS == 0
00792 
00793   class IdxDim {
00794   public:
00795     intg dim[MAXDIMS];
00796     intg ndim;
00797     
00799     IdxDim() {
00800       ndim = -1;
00801     }
00802 
00803     IdxDim(const IdxSpec &s) {
00804       read(s);
00805     }
00806 
00807     void read(const IdxSpec &s) {
00808       ndim = s.ndim;
00809       memcpy(dim, s.dim, s.ndim * sizeof (intg)); // copy input dimensions
00810       // set remaining to -1
00811       memset(dim + s.ndim, -1, (MAXDIMS - s.ndim) * sizeof (intg)); 
00812     }
00813 
00814     void setdim(intg dimn, intg size) {
00815       if (dimn >= ndim)
00816         ylerror("cannot change the order of IdxDim");
00817       dim[dimn] = size; 
00818     }
00819 
00820     virtual ~IdxDim() {};
00821 
00822     // friends
00823     friend class IdxSpec;
00824   };
00825 
00826 } // end namespace ebl
